# Routely: Type-Safe React Router

Routely is a type-safe React router with a plugin architecture. It provides type safety, lazy loading, navigation guards, and search parameter management.

## Quick Start

```typescript
import { createRouter, route, Outlet, useNavigate, useParams } from '@oxog/routely-core';

// Define routes
const routes = [
  route('/', () => import('./pages/Home')),
  route('/users/:userId', () => import('./pages/UserDetail')),
];

// Create router
const router = createRouter({ routes });

// Use in app
function App() {
  return (
    <router.RouterProvider router={router}>
      <Outlet />
    </router.RouterProvider>
  );
}

// Navigate programmatically
function SomeComponent() {
  const navigate = useNavigate();
  const { userId } = useParams<{ userId: string }>();
  
  // Navigate with type safety
  navigate(`/users/${userId}`);
}
```

## API Reference

### Core Functions

- `createRouter({ routes })` - Creates a router instance with route definitions
- `route(path, component, children?)` - Defines a route with optional nested routes
- `useNavigate()` - Hook for programmatic navigation
- `useParams<T>()` - Hook for accessing route parameters with type safety
- `useLocation()` - Hook for accessing current location
- `Outlet` - Component for rendering nested routes

### Plugins

- `lazyPlugin(options)` - Code splitting with lazy loading
- `guardsPlugin(options)` - Navigation guards for protected routes
- `searchPlugin()` - Type-safe URL search parameters
- `scrollPlugin(options)` - Scroll position management
- `transitionPlugin(options)` - Page transition animations
- `breadcrumbPlugin(options)` - Breadcrumb navigation
- `devtoolsPlugin(options)` - Developer tools

## Plugin Installation

```typescript
router.use(lazyPlugin({ timeout: 3000 }));
router.use(guardsPlugin({ guards: [...] }));
```

## Route Patterns

- Static: `/about`
- Dynamic: `/users/:userId`
- Nested: Parent routes with children arrays
- Catch-all: `*` for 404 pages

## Type Safety

All route parameters are automatically typed. Use TypeScript generics for full type safety:

```typescript
const { userId } = useParams<{ userId: string }>();
```

For more information, see the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/oxog/routely).
